newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH GROUP BIDS FOR RUCH NEWSSTAND CHAIN.
newsitem.headline: POLISH GROUP BIDS FOR RUCH NEWSSTAND CHAIN.

text.p: The Universal SA led Polish Capital Group (PGK) placed a bid for at least 10 percent of shares of the country's largest newsstand chain RUCH SA, PGK said in a statement on Thursday.
Last week Poland invited new bids for RUCH, after calling off talks with a consortium led by French Hachette when it failed to improve its offer.
PGK said that RUCH, which owns 17,000 kiosks nationwide and controls 65 percent of Poland's press distribution market, was worth some $200 million.
It said that it planned to give RUCH employees shares worth some $30 million and that it was ready to talk about social packages which could include individual work guarantees.

Hachette, which had signed an initial agreement with the treasury ministry late last year on a purchase of 75 percent of Ruch, has threatened unspecified action against the Polish government if it cancels the deal.
